pages.text: Well, it's Halloween. I know it sounds stupid but I've been thinking of dressing up, just for old times sake. My kids used to love Halloween. I wonder what my kids are dressing up as for Halloween. The other day I was in a small village trying to get some food for myself and I nearly thorned a lady when she refused to trade me for

some fruit. It scares me that my body's natural reaction now is to shoot thorns at people, but I don't know if there's anything I can really do about it. I was thinking that maybe if I released some anger occasionally in the form of thorns it might help with the urges to shoot people with them, but I don't know where I would go. I don't know if I would even want to do it. It still hurts when I

use the thorns so I'm kind of scared to use them. I'm also scared that I'll get used to the pain and become a stone-cold cactus. Every day I feel myself become more and more violent, not by choice. I think my body is slowly turning me into a cactus, but if that's the case, I don't know how much longer I have... Which also scares me. I need to try and head into the closest village to find a
costume for Halloween. For some reason, although I'm not with them, it makes me feel closer to my children if I dress up in a ridiculous costume.
